Due to traffic congestion in Melbourne CBD:

1 % Average speed slow down 1 Minutes Extra travel time per day 1 Million avoidable cost per year

Traffic in Melbourne

Melbourne Bike Share

Victoria government has worked together with RACV and PTV to encourage people to ride public bicycles.

Find out more

Traffic Congestion

Traffic congestion is getting more and more serious in Melbourne CBD, and millions of people waste time in traffic jams.

View Current traffic conditions

Melbourne Bicycle Plan

Melbourne has been planning to improve people's riding experience by improving bicycle networks, existing routes, and making it accessible for all ages and abilities.

ViewÂ Bicycle Plan

Why Ride a Bicycle?

healthier lifestyle

Taking 15 to 30 minutes on average to ride a bicycle can not only get you to your office, but can also help you keep fit.

Work efficiency

Riding a bicycle can largely help you to increase your productivity because it helps you to improve your fitness and mental health.

item.title: Bike Info
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
All you Need to know about riding a bicycle

  • Get your first bicycle

  • Tips about riding a bicycle

  • Where to get help, how to lock up and riding with children

Get your first bicycle

GoodCycles

"As a social enterprise, we use bikes to change lives by supporting employment pathways for young people who need a helping hand."

99Bike

"Our South Melbourne bike shop has a huge range of road bikes, commuter bikes, fixie bikes, cruiser bikes, and kids bikes. Open 7 days."

Ponybikes

"Ponybikes is a unique bicycle workshop" which focuses on clients' individual needs requirements. Passion for bicycle is highly valued here.

Cycles Galleria

"We are Melbourne's favourite bike shop. We proudly have the best products, locations and people to serve anyone who rides a bike - you!"

Summit Cycles

"Australia's high-performance mountain bike stores. Our focus is offering the best product, service, and price in the industry."

bikeNOW

"Experience Melbourne and Victoria in the most enjoyable way. bikeNOW have a range of bikes for hire, for anywhere between two hours and two months."

tips about riding a bicycle

  • Wear a Helmet

Wearing a helmet not only looks great, but also can save your life when you fall.

  • Pump up tyres

Correct pressure of your tyres can make your riding much easier and happier.

  • Check the brakes

Check your brakes before you ride so that you won't bump into things, especially if you live on the hill.

  • adjust your seat

If you feel the height or position is not comfortable, you can adjust your seat so that your trip can be more comfortable.

  • lock up your bike

Losing your bike is not a joke, and it is happening everyday to many people. Lock up your bike even if you are at home.

  • Light up at night

Lighting up is not only about showing yourself the road, but also about making other drivers know you are riding.

More tips for new riders

Where to get help

  • Your GP for health benefits
  • Smartplay Victoria Tel. (03) 9674 8777
  • Bicycle Network Victoria Tel. (03) 8376 8888
  • VicRoads Tel. 13 11 71

Find Out More

How to lock up

It doesn't matter if you have a brand new fancy bicycle, or you have a bicycle that accompanied you for years, its always good to lock it up and keep it safe.

Find Out More

ride with children

Fancy a family day out with your children? Having a bicycle trip together is a good choice!Â

item.title: Calculator
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
travel smart

let numbers talk

Figure out your carbon footprint, cost saving, and calories burnt by riding a bicycle

  • Calculate Carbon Footprint
  • Calculate Calorie
  • Calculate Cost Difference

Do you know:

Trees remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

As estimated, saving 1 ton of CO2 is equivalent to planting 15 adult trees.

Enter the distance travelled by car Select the type of car you drive

Total: (Kg)

You would produce: (Kg) of carbon dioxide

You produce: (Kg) of carbon dioxide

Take away notes:

If you drive 25 km per day for a year, you destroy 15 trees in the forest!

Check our public bicycle map and let's get started!

Do you know:

An average woman needs to eat about 2000 calories per day to maintain, and 1500 calories to lose one pound of weight per week.

An average man needs 2500 calories to maintain, and 2000 to lose one pound of weight per week.

Please enter your weight (kg) BicycleWalk Please select your exercise type Please enter the time spent(min)

Total: (Cal)

You can burn: (Cal)

You can burn: (Cal)

Take away notes:

100 calories means three and a half squares of milk chocolate.

Select the type of car you own Select your alternative to driving a car Enter the distance you usually travel

Total: (AUD)

This is your cost saving if you choose an alternative to driving a car.

You can save: (AUD)

You can save: (AUD)

Share Bicycle

Click and find out more about share bicycle in Melbourne

Calories Burnt

Cycling is not only a great way to travel, but also to burn calories and lose weight. Click and see more about how many calories you burnt.

Fuel Cost Calculator

Fuel is the largest and on-going cost of driving a car. Click and find out more about how much cost you incur on fuel in Australia.

item.title: Infrastructure Maps
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Facility map

find the closest facilities

Smart Travel provides you the most convenient and enjoyable cycling experience with all the facilities you need.

[wpgmza id="8"] "What I love about these maps is that it shows so clearly where to find the facility I want so that my city trips can be much easier and enjoyable. I will definitely recommend to my friends!"
Alene Elvine HR Manager âThe maps was everything I hoped for, and more. Smart Travel really makes a difference, I should have never tolerated the annoying congestion. Now I can do more outdoor exercise and never worry about to find a place to drink! Jonas Gerber Designer

item.title: bike sharing station & bike directions
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Melbourne Bike Share

Use the map below to get directions to bike around the city using the Melbourne Share bicycles.You will be shown the best bike routes.Â 

  • Enter your source and destination in the 'From' and 'To' fields respectively.
  • Select your choice of route and click on 'Get Direction' on the top right corner of the box.

Facilities

Click here or scroll down to view facilities such as Toilets and Water Fountains to help you when you are tired of riding your bicycle around the city.

  • Enter the ZIP or address in the bar and select the radius from your location.
  • Click on the 'Search' icon to view the facilities within that radius and you can use your facility.

  • Toilet map
  • Drinking fountain map
